Posts.Content: Dustysmom wrote: July 22nd I had a diagnostic mammogram to follow up on a lumpectomy on the right for dcis with clear margins.  I sensed that something was wrong on the left and they performed a diagnostic mammogram on the left as well.  The left side has calcifications in two locations with one with an associated nodule.  That is all that I know right now.  I had a US and it could not be located.  Today I had a mri to see if they could do a biopsy by mri-guidance.  They just called and said that the radiologist wanted to do a stereotactic instead.  Would this be good news or bad news?  If they could find it on US, and they don't want to do it by mri, could this be better news?  I can't stand the waiting since I have already had the lumpectomy on the right.  I hav not had rads or tamox for the right side.  I am waiting to decide if bmx or not.  Any ideas? I don't feel very peaceful right now... Nikki, post BMX skin sparing, nipple preservation and TE's for now. Exchange hopefully by end of July. Dx 5/7/2009, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Calcifications on the left in two locations Dustysmom Dustysmom

Posts.Content: Aug 18, 2009 12:17PM Dustysmom wrote: Beesie, Thank you for your response.  I just received the MRI report... The MRI reports that there is an indeterminate reticular ductal enhancing process 34 X 11 X 9 mmwhich co-localizes with the cluster of microcalcifications found on the diagnostic mammogram of 07/22/09, there is a second 25mm in diameter region of non-specific reticular enhancement which appears to co-localize with the dominant cluster of indeterminate microcalcifications seen on the aforementioned mammogram.  In addition, there is a third suspicious reticular/ductal enhancing legion measuring 11 X 6 X 3mm.This third finding is the most prominent focus of enhancement in either breast.  Bi-Rads 4B I have a sterotactic scheduled for Aug 31ST ...so now there is a third. Thoughts?
Posts.Title: Calcifications on the left in two locations Dustysmom Dustysmom

Posts.Content: Dustysmom wrote: I should  be an expert by now.  My right breast took me on a six month adventure with DCIS being the outcome... Now my left breast, being jealous is providing totally differentexperiences.  Yesterday, I had a stereotactic in two locations, 3:00 and 12:00. Additionally, there is another leasion at 2:30, but that one they want to biopsy via a MRI-guided biopsy.  They said that they won't look at that one until we get the results back from the other two. It started this way...follow up mammo for R lumpectomy.  I mentioned that I thought I felt something on the left as well.  As you can see I was right.  They first tried to do a US-guided biopsy, but they couldn't find the lesions on US.  One week later I had a MRI to see if it could be done with MRI-guided, but the radiologist felt it was better to do the 9&12:00 via stereotactic.  But the MRI was where they found the third lesion.   My onc is suggesting a bilat Mast.  I think at this point I am getting pretty scared. Thanks for anyone's wisdom Nikki, post BMX skin sparing, nipple preservation and TE's for now. Exchange hopefully by end of July. Dx 5/7/2009, DCIS, <1cm, Stage 0, Grade 1, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Apr 6, 2010 10:50PM Dustysmom wrote: Come on Hellome...you can do it.  I'll tell you what, I'll go first.  OK?  I don't know what time zone you are in, but we can pretend that I will go first as long as you promise to have my back, OK?  Great, it's settled!  Thanks for the kind words, Paxton.  I really do feel much better today. I took one anti-anxiety drug [forgot the name right now], and I finally slept really well last night.  Yeah, sure I am scared, but my little Dusty and my DH are worth everything to me.  I want to grow really old and bounce those grandbabies on my knee and then go to their college graduation. I forgot to mention that I am having skin and nipple sparing utilizing the alloderm to have a really nice internal bra.  BS and PS both say no more bras!!!  I am really lucky.  My Onc, BS, and PS are all women.  The BS told me that she said that the odds of having BC herself was really high so she felt specializing in breast surgery would keep her in the forefront. She is young and vibrant and reminds me of gina davis...I met the PS for the first time last week and our appointment ended with a hug.  OMG, Irishtess, that is fantastic news.  You are the day after me and Hellome. It really breaks my heart when I realize what difficult and heroic choices we all have to make.  Recently, I was remembering seeing the cover of People Magazine a couple of years ago and thinking how scary and how brave the decision Christina Applegate made regarding her BMX...I felt so badly for her, I mean internally felt such empathy.  It is unbelievable that here I sit with all of you brave women facing the same thing. lorieg...you are in my prayers, swift recovery! Blessing to all, NIKKI

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2010 09:29PM Dustysmom wrote: Lisa,  that's right you have a 4 yr old boy.  They are a handful, but they love their Mommys.  A one year-old little girl...how precious.  My son wants to know who the "aunt" of his children will be.  He already decided that when I am old, I will be their grandmother. You are so right...I got the nerve to do this because of my two guys DH & DS. Good luck getting the drains out...I can only hope.  I see PS & BS tomorrow... ~NIKKI

I started feeling really creepy yesterday...I don't know maybe cabin fever.  Sometimes I feel like I could just tear the expanders out of my chest.  Achy all the time and I think there is some additional swelling.  I see the docs on Monday. I don't think she could make out the photo.  Anyway, I will be glad to see them both tomorrow.  And I will keep praying I am not going to loose the skin. I will catch up with posts tomorrow... NIKKI

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2010 01:09AM Dustysmom wrote: OK, for sure now I am losing my mind!  If I don't have enough stuff going on...16 months no period.  More than 12 months equals menopause, right?  Well, Saturday, a period to end all periods.  I have been soaking through everything.  I tried to look it up on-line, but that just scared me to pieces.  I am wondering if it is just the stress of all that is coming in a few short weeks.  I guess I need to make an appointment with my OB/GYN, but  can't seem to make that call.  I am negative for the Braca gene, but my maternal aunt died from ovarian cancer just a few years ago.  I think I am trying the ostrich method right now. Oh and on top of everything else, my BS and PS haven't completely settled on the surgery date.  I would prefer the 14th, but I think they are leaning on the16th.  I need family to take care of my four year old son,  he needs to be distracted.  He has never been without me more than a day.  I wish they would settle on the date. Have any of you been given approx recovery time.  My BS I can go back to work in two weeks, my PS says 4-6 weeks.  Does anyone know more information? I am losing it...

Posts.Content: Mar 30, 2010 05:50PM Dustysmom wrote: Good point, Lori.  I didn't think about the anemia factor.  I better pop those vitamins.  I am going to schedule a OB/GYN tomorrow.  I had to wait until I see my neurologist tomorrow, I am trying toget clearance for sicicone implants rather than saline.  I have been on the edge of being diagnosed with MS for about 5 years.  Strange white lesions on the gray matter of my brain, but never clearly MS.  My PS wants me to check with Neuro before the implant decision.  Oh, and joy of joys, I think I have found skin cancer on my back just below my shoulder blade.  What gives? Just trying to get through the BMX surgery is enough. Brigid...my prayers are going out to you.  Looking forward to your swift recovery.  You are the torch-bearer for all of us! You all take care... Nikki

Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2010 09:18PM - edited Apr 5, 2010 09:22PM by Dustysmom I don't know about you guys...but I just spent 6 1/2 hours for preops.  10:AM appt with BS, then upstairs to the lab for tons of tubes, then walk across the street to have a chest xray, then down four blocks to check in for surgery, pay co-payment, then EKG in preop center, then back to BS office to pick up "binders" Oh, no, they don't take my insurance, that's OK, I'll pay cash. Then the other direction to see the PS to sign consents.  I mean really, don't they think it is stressful enough.  I essentially missed an entire day of work.  My surgery is a week away and I feel so discombobulated.  Bridgidko and lsf, we haven't heard anything...I pray that they are both doing good.  Hopefully, we will hear from them soon.  Prayers for Candyb today and cafelovr tomorrow! Can someone remind me where to find the packing list?  Also, my BS suggested to do a mental task journal.  That way I can make a list of tasks that my DH or friends that can help me with as I recover.  It seems like the only way that I will be able to release control.  Did I mention I am a control freak?  I need to make a list of all the "stuff" I feel like I need to do for my 4-yr old. OMG, I am completely rambling... NIKKI My DH is out of town from Thursday to Sunday.  I am hoping to get a lot of things done this weekend.
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2010 02:07AM Dustysmom wrote: It is amazing.  I just read the last several posts and I feel that it is "I" that wrote them...I am feeling slightly sick with a scratchy throat and sniffles, low-grade blah.  If I think about the upcoming surgery I go numb...kind of like it's not really happening.  Then I read the posts of the gals that had their's this month and it is a reality check.  I just got home from Disneyland with my four-year old.  Had a great time and wanted to just share some one-on-one time with him since I will not be handling him alone for a while.  My DH is out of town this weekend at a religious retreat.  At first I was mad he would be gone so close to my surgery and now, I am so relieved that he is away and I can kind of flit around with the wifey responsibilities.  My son doesn't care that I haven't done the dishes today. I got a call from my husband's isurance carrier...United Healthcare for T-Mobile, I thought, "Oh, great, in the eleventh  hour, I am going to have to go to battle for my surgery."  I called them back ready for a fight and guess what?  It was a RN for them making sure that my PS and my BS had given me adequate information about before, after and during the procedure.  Instructing me to make sure that I clear a pathway in my house so that when I get home I won't have an falls or stumbles.  The phone number to the 24-hour ask a nurse line in case I had misc questions when I got home.  A number to the Employee-assitance program for counseling in case I got too stressed this week. and she finished up the call with, "I am sending positive healing vibes and prayers for a safe surgery and a speedy recovery."  So after I picked myself up off the floor... Jenni, I am keeping you in my prayers.   Lori, thanks for the update...I hope that I will be minimally medicated.  I am so happy you are through the surgery and are on the mend. Victoria21, you and I and Hellome are all scheduled for Tuesday...seems really close.  I told my staffers that I was planning an utilizing chemicals rather liberally this coming week so I would touch base with them after the 19th.  e We all have to just keep the "Faith". Blessings, Nikki

I love the "I don't have to be brave, I just have to show up"!  That's kind of how I feel, like a lamb to the slaughter...here are my wrists, just handcuff them and take me away.  Obviously, the waiting game is the worst.  The anticipation is the torture! OK, heading out the door to church. Blessings, NIKKI

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2010 07:40PM Dustysmom wrote: Lori and Jessamine...I was being given colace in the hospital everyday until today.  I need to send DH to the store, whichever he can find.  I really can't imagine "straining".  I still have a tremendous pain over sternum "breast bone", I don't know if they used it for a fulcrum, but it is so painful.  I think the TE's are pushing against this area too.  I am numb below and tender above.  Still draining and feeling odd sensations. How soon do drains come out?  Thanks for the advice on sleep, Suz.  I will just nap as necessary.  I think my 4 yr old comes home tomorrow.  Give me strength... Hugs to all, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2010 09:03PM Dustysmom wrote: Funny, I hadn't thought about bras...until now.  I realize how sad that actually is.  I am a "Victoria's Secret" junkie.  I have a lingerie chest from the old "Bombay Company" full of matching sets.  :(           I guess I blocked all of that out.  Well...there goes the seduction!  I think I am now feeling old at 53! OK, sorry, I think I am really feeling sorry for myself.  My DH left me with our four-year-old for eight+ hours.  He had to go to a class to teach Sunday school in LA which is so far away.  I am feel like pouting and throwing a tantrum myself.  DH called 30 minutes to say that he is on his way home.  He is 1 1/2 hours away and I am so tired.  I expected him to be home by now and I still have to wait another hour. I think I am experiencing seromas under both arms.  I had the drains removed on Friday, so maybe it is normal.  It just seems like they are getting spongier and puffier and warmer than the rest of the area.  My BMX was 12 days ago, I just don't know if this is normal.  I read on a website that this is caused by doing too much while you should be resting.  I hope I didn't screw up anything. Thanks for letting me rant.  And no grammar check, please...LOL! NIKKI

Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2010 06:14PM - edited Apr 16, 2010 06:16PM by Dustysmom Yea, home from the hospital.  Not too bad.  I had an absolutely terrible time with nasea from the anethesia. I had to spend an extra day in the hospital.  Couldn't get rid of my headache...Zofram (sp) kept giving me headaches..Finally Compazine yesterday and only minimal headache..Only two drains.  My surgery was BMX and they were able to do the skin sparing and the nipple preservation.  Final path unchanged from preop, but nodes negative too!!!  No dressing changes until see PS Monday afternoon.  No bras or binder.  PS was able to fill 200cc's per side, so now I look like a 12 yr old.  Pain tolerable, but tired.  PS do nothing...sleep, heal, eat & pee until I see her. Just when I thought I was going to freak before surgery...they gave me the nite-nite drugs.  Surgery 7 hours... Good luck to all the girls still waiting... Love, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 17, 2010 01:38PM - edited Apr 17, 2010 01:39PM by Dustysmom Hi All, Now that I am home 24 hours... Had to be at hospital at 11AM for a 1PM surgery.  Both of my pastors joined my DH and I at about 15 minutes till surgery.  The OR was running late so I didn't get taken till 1:45PM, that's when I started to panic.  I sort of awakened in PACU, but I couldn't open my eyes.  Moved to my room on the oncology floor.  The transfer from gurney to bed painful.But then not too bad.  Glad to have a Foley catheter.  But at 6AM about 9 hours post surgery they took out the Foley...my nurse reported that I was like a statue and needed to get up.  MY DH spent the night in a cot at my bedside.  I think that helped that nurse to be nice to me.  She didn't seem very compassionate.  The rest of the staff was great.  The first day post op I walked the halls and sat in a chair for 4 hours strait.  But the next day I was so nauseated, and such a headache.  I couldn't imagine going home.  Fortunately, by the next day all was well.  I haven't had any pain meds in 9 hours, so I think I am on the mend.  I am very weak.  Still have a mild headache.  But now I understand how so many women say this is doable.  On this side it seems so much easier than the anticipation. My only problem is no bm post op! 4 days... Fast healing for all who have gone before.  Easy for those waiting for this coming week or the next. We are all powerful women.  Strength and courage! Love, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 7, 2010 11:08AM Dustysmom wrote: Good Morning to all you Special Ladies! I have been trying to catch up on everyone's news.  It is so hard to believe that it has already been 3 1/2 weeks since my BMX. Regarding the drain pulls,  I was so scared to have them pulled, I tried to ignore how scared I was until it was time to come out.  But at the moment my PS's assistant went to pull them out I realized that if I thought about the removal, I would loose it.  So I asked her to tell me about her upcoming weekend.  I got so sidetracked listening to her wonderful story, she was done before I knew she had started.  So my advice is to get distracted! We have shared so much over the past weeks, did anyone notice how amazing the support we can give to and receive from each other while taking a path so impossible to survive that it takes my breath away.  To see that we are now on the other side, it is a testament to each of us how strong we really are.  You know that they test the purity of metal by putting it to the fire. You see?  We all proved to be made of more than we ever thought possible. Amazing!  I am taking this as the new direction of my life. I can't wait to be healed and ready to take on the world, or at least my world! As far as fatigue, it continues to be a problem for me too.  I am sleeping better, but still prefer the recliner for the best sleep.  I am so looking forward to being Mom and Wife again, it is time.  Since I contracted an infection on the left suture line, I am sort of at square one as far as the healing goes.  I see the surgeon this afternoon and hopefully the cultures come back with nothing too serious.  I am allergic to a few antibiotics so perhaps they might be able to find a more effective treatment.  At least the wound has closed back up and the redness has subsided, it didn't seem possible last weekend. Happy Mother's Day to all the Moms! Nikki
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2009 11:26AM Dustysmom wrote: Thank you so much.  I will look her up and see if I can get an appointment.  This is a great time of the year to visit there too.
Posts.Title: Looking for a BS in Inland Empire of California Dustysmom car

Posts.Content: Mar 4, 2009 04:37PM Dustysmom wrote: Well, thank you CAR and everyone! Today, I went to the surgeon that my Primary had referred me to for a second opinion.  First off, it is rather disconcerting to visit a MD that seems young enough to be my son, I know off the subject but I thought that he was nice, but he didn't actually understand thaf I had a pretty good handle on what was going on.  He said that he was going to personally go to the hospital to review the digital films with the CAD and to spend a few days thinking about what to do before he proceeds.  He says that he doen't normally do an excisional bx at this point and then he educated me that ADH is not cancer, and that DCIS isn't really cancer...blah, blah, blah.  He asked if I had a hx of bc in the family and I said only my maternal gm who was 86 yrs old when she had a mastectomy.  However, my mother, never had a mammo so we really can't determine an adequate hx. He then does the physical exam and leaves the room.  When he returns, now he is saying that perhaps I should consider Tamoxifen and that he was possible going to refer me to an ongologist to determine the need for Tamox.  I just feel that he was consulting a "book" while he was out of the room and this makes me concerned about his experience.   First he is making "light" of it and then he seems more concerned.  Maybe I am reading too much into it, but it certainly makes me wonder. I am going to contact Dr Synder @ Hoag and get a more experienced second opinion.  I feel like I appear to be chasing ghosts or something like I am looking for cancer, but I am just scared that it is only a couple of mm away and we just don't know it.  The doctor I saw today summarized it like this...if you took a solid loaf of raisin bread and took a core sample, you might miss the raisins, but you would still have raisin bread regardless.  Hmm...I wonder who told him that? Trying not to sound paranoid, NIKKI
Posts.Title: Looking for a BS in Inland Empire of California Dustysmom car

Posts.Content: Apr 18, 2010 07:32PM Dustysmom wrote: My 4yr old home...showed him the dressings and the drains.  His eyes got as  big as dinner plates.  I said, "Mommy had surgery on her chest and has some owies."  He said "Does it hurt?", with teared up eyes.  "Not so bad honey, I just need to rest."  He hugged my knees asked about lunch.  I missed him so much...had never been apart for even one night.  That was five!  I am glad DH can cover!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 28, 2010 03:10PM Dustysmom wrote: I found that using lanyards to hold the drains gave me more freedom of movement and easier to drain since they hung from my neck so they were always handy in front.  I wore a thin ribbed skinny white tank top over the incisions so the drains were outside of that. Then topped it off with baggy "wrinkled-style" shirts that I just bought extra-large.  When the PS & the BS saw the lanyards (2) one for each drain, they had never heard of it before and really liked the idea.  The lanyards were from some ID badge holders I had, with non-stretching black cords. I hope this helps...

Hmm... Nikki
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 1, 2010 03:33PM Dustysmom wrote: Finally got my surgery date  - April 13th @ 1:00PM.  Two nights in the hospital.  Now we have to confirm who is watching my 4 yr old.  He handled my lumpectomy last May...no, no, no don't touch Mommy's chest she has an owie.  I sure hope he will show restraint when he runs up to hug me.  Interestingly enough, my BS said to be sure not to lift him but keep him close, keep touching him.  I am wondering if that was for him or for me.  Maybe that's the secret...keeping the loved ones closer may help is heal swiftly.  I will pray, that is the secret! Thank you to all that have provided pointers and insight...we are lucky to have such a wonderful bunch of gals that are willing to share all the wisdom. I have three separate areas of the left that are BI-Rad 5.  We decided not to do a lumpectomy since it would turn into a partial mastectomy anyway.  And since I never began the 37 treatments of radiation...my oncologist says this is the best way to go...now I have learned that the path report in surgery will determine if I will require chemo afterwards.  Hopefully it is just DCIS in a larger area. Blessings, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 7, 2010 06:47PM Dustysmom wrote: CandyB...thanks a million for your post and your pointers!!!  So pleased that you are home and over on the other side. Prayers for a final clear path report.  I want to find out about the pain pump! Cafelovr Amazing  you posted so soon. Your words of encouragement are so welcomed.  I guess it all goes back to the "Only thing to fear, is fear itself." I have many people around me that can't believe that I am so "calm"  Are they kidding??  I just don't have time to panic.  I am supposed to be in the hospital for 3days/2nights. That seems longer than CandyB or Cafelovr, I wonder if I might get to go home sooner and the docs just want to have me prepared for thelonger.  We will see... Blessings to all, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 10, 2010 11:45AM Dustysmom wrote: OK, definitely has to be  nerves.  Woke up with a killer headache.  Drank a huge bottle of water and took two extra-strength Tylenol.  And then within an hour I started feeling sweaty and nauseous, threw it all up. AARRGGHH!
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: Apr 24, 2010 01:14PM Dustysmom wrote: Hi Ladies! I really needed to "tune out" for a while.  I got my drains out yesterday.  Not feeling too bad, just wish for a speedy recovery.  I am  not allowed to drive or do anything yet.  I don't see the doctors again until May 6th.  Hopefully, by then, I will be able to drive and perform some stretching and movement exercises for my arms and shoulders. I have just been wearing white rib-knit tank tops under everything and then topping off with a baggy shirt.  I won't get any additional fills to the TE until week 4 which is about May 14th.  The PS filled with 200ccs during surgery. Thelma312 - same surgery, huh.  I wish you luck.  I am unsure if my doctor's are extra conservative or not, but they seem to go really slow with any rehab...no driving yet, no exercise and not lifting over 2 lbs.  I don't know if it is because they are protecting the skin and nipple, but the PS told me to do nothing. My prayers are with all of you lovely ladies.  To Annacortessgirl, Choirlove, dcrm, and  Jessamine...remember the quote from earlier in the month, "You don't have to be brave, you just have to show up".  Seriously, this is what got me through the last couple of days before surgery. I know that I was not brave!  I just had to show up!  When I became the most "paranoid" was just as they gave me the preop drugs...and then it was all over.  So hang in there! Can you believe this month is almost up??? Care to all, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine

Posts.Content: May 23, 2010 04:09PM Dustysmom wrote: Hi to All, It's official...I go back to work tomorrow.  I am the office manager/HR mgr/ and acting controller...hopefully it won't be too backed up.  I am blessed two wonderfull assistants. I am back to feeling pretty much like my old self.  I can handle most anything now.  The only restriction is no weight bearing for example no "downward facing dog" or push ups in the forseeable future.  I haven't had any fills since surgery (300cc's on both sides) on April 13th due to an infection 3 wks postop.  I still have to wait two more weeks for fills, since PS didn't want to risk a repeat infection.   I still look extremely misshapen and I work in a 90% male dominated job.  Oh, well... Totally thrill I made the decision on a BMX...path report had a few additional locations of DCIS never picked up by mammo or MRI last fall. Good luck going back to work Leisa and Karla! Blessings to All, NIKKI
Posts.Title: april 2010 masectomy rayofsun jessamine
